dialogues.text: Fifield stumbles along. Exhausted. Pouring sweat inside h suit. He is hopelessly lost. He slams into a resinous structure that topples to the floor. Things break. He whips his light around in jittery paranoia. Taps at hi comm controls, getting only static. In Fifield’s headlamp beam, the blackness is filling with motes of light. A blizzard of tiny flying insects. SCARABS .

dialogues.speaker: FIFIELD
dialogues.text: Fifield to Magellan. Come on, come on. Anybody, seriously! God damn it! Scarabs flit through the darkness around him. They alight his shoulders. Crawl over his visor. Obscuring his vision

dialogues.speaker: FIFIELD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get off! He swats at his visor, killing some. The crushed insects produce acid that eats into the plexiglass in seconds.  56.

dialogues.speaker: FIFIELD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: shit. He twists, craning with his flashlight to inspect himself Brushes scarabs away right and left. Acid opens a hole in his visor. Scarabs are inside. Buzzi around his head. Fifield freaks out, clawing at his helme A scarab bites his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH ON
dialogues.text: The microscopic world - as strange DNA invades Fifield’s bloodstream. Virulent strands of protein attack the nativ DNA, transforming...

dialogues.speaker: FIFIELD
dialogues.text: As his pupils dilate, breath hissing into his nostrils. H expanding body stiffens as if shocked by a powerful elect current. He screams. Falls, convulsing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The storm batters the ship, bouncing it on its suspension SCIENTISTS’ CABIN - NIGHT Watts and Holloway lie in bed, exhausted. Arms around eac other. Watts stares into space.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: We found the gods. And they’ve been murdered.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLOWAY
dialogues.text: You've pried too many arrowheads out of old skulls to get squeamish now. They've been dead what, eighteen hundred years? Two thousand?

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: What could kill them? Holloway contemplates the question.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLOWAY
dialogues.text: Who knows? (he laughs bitterly) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: HOLLOWAY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But I guess we know why they never came back to us. Something killed them off - back around the time of Christ. Maybe He was one of them! A great teacher, sent from Heaven? Jesus. The last Engineer.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: Martin, stop! She slaps at him. Holloway laughs.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Janek stands at the Bridge window, staring out into the storm. Buffeting clouds and howling winds. The lighthouse beams of the Magellan’s beacons sweeping through the clou He plays his squeeze box in the teeth of the storm.

dialogues.speaker: JANEK
dialogues.text: (singing) You'll come a-waltzing, Matilda, with me... Behind him, DAVID appears on the Bridge. Steals across th Bridge to a ladder. Descends into the compartment below..

dialogues.speaker: NAVIGATION COMPUTER ROOM
dialogues.text: DAVID activates the navigation computer terminal: light bathes his face. His fingers fly over the keyboard, silen and swiftly, with superhuman dexterity.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (quietly) Activate. Administrative override.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daylight filters through the clouds. The storm has passed The Magellan sits intact on its landing struts. INT. MAGELLAN - VICKERS’S SUITE - SECRET ROOM - DAWN The high-tech room hums at a different frequency now. Indicator lights green and ready. Vickers throws switches  58. Four HIBERNATION PODS slide out of the metal walls. From pod, a muscular SOLDIER rouses from sleep. They are scarr and crew-cut. Tough customers. They wake like veterans. Their leader sits up and clasps his head with a wince. Th is CAPTAIN SHEPHERD, a career mercenary who has followed highest paycheck to this strange duty.

dialogues.speaker: VICKERS
dialogues.text: Captain Shepherd.

dialogues.speaker: SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: (squinting in the light) Reporting. Lydia Vickers. I’m your authority.

dialogues.speaker: SHEPHERD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Understood.

dialogues.speaker: VICKERS
dialogues.text: I‘ll brief you on the way. We need to move.

dialogues.speaker: SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: No breakfast?

dialogues.speaker: CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Vickers strides forward. Four soldiers at her heels: Capt Shepherd, VIGODA, RAY, and CARD. They walk in unison, the boots drumming on the deck. SCIENTISTS’ CABIN Holloway and Watts lie sleeping. The distant drum of marc feet rouses them. Watts frowns at Holloway.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: E.V.A. ROOM
dialogues.text: The prep room inside the airlocks. A soldier, VIGODA, wai there: a slim dark man with an air of calm. Holloway and Watts arrive in civilian clothes, perplexed.  59.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLOWAY
dialogues.text: Where is everybody? We can’t - (he stops short) Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: VIGODA
dialogues.text: Captain Janek took his crew out to retrieve his missing men. They never came in.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLOWAY
dialogues.text: And you are...

dialogues.speaker: VIGODA
dialogues.text: Vigoda. Weyland Security detail. The scientists are dumbfounded. His presence is impossibl

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: Where’d you come from?

dialogues.speaker: VIGODA
dialogues.text: Director’s call to brief you on that. I’m supposed to escort you to the worksite.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLOWAY
dialogues.text: Worksite? Vigoda glances at a mapping unit.

dialogues.speaker: VIGODA
dialogues.text: Haven’t been out yet. I understand it’s in some kind of pyramid. CORRIDOR - VICKERS’S CABIN DOOR A furious Holloway and Watts, trailed by Vigoda, arrive a Vickers’s cabin. They are astonished to find Shepherd standing guard at the door. VICKERS’S SUITE Vickers sits calmly at her desk. Holloway and Watts stand front of her, bristling.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLOWAY
dialogues.text: Why wasn’t I told about these additional personnel?

dialogues.speaker: VICKERS
dialogues.text: They're my personnel. On my ship.  60.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: What are the guns for? Vickers looks at them unflappably. Sure of her ground now

dialogues.speaker: VICKERS
dialogues.text: I’m being careful. These new finds give our work a new importance.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: You should have talked to us. Martin’s mission leader. That’s in our contract.

dialogues.speaker: VICKERS
dialogues.text: The second you found alien technology, control of this mission reverted to me. That's in your contract too. Watts and Holloway exchange grim looks. Vickers has them.

dialogues.speaker: VICKERS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mr. Weyland’s pouring trillions into Mars. He’s spent a fortune building ships like the Magellan to search for colony planets. But Earthlike worlds are vanishingly rare. The right distance from the sun, the right atmosphere, enough water... She glances across the suite at her holographic display: live feed from the pyramid worksite, where DAVID works on terraforming equipment.

dialogues.speaker: VICKERS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is a technology to transform worlds. He’ll never give it up. (she turns to face them) And neither will I.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLOWAY
dialogues.text: The science must come first. You can wait until we’ve documented...

dialogues.speaker: VICKERS
dialogues.text: You're standing on an alien world courtesy of Weyland Industries. Be grateful. Watts approaches the holography terminal, staring at the images in horror.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: What are they doing in there?!  61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts and Holloway, in space suits, arrive on the scene: Powerful floodlights illuminate the core chamber, beating back the gloom. A fine spray of water falls out of the darkness overhead. DAVID, Chance, and Ravel are dismantling the hulking mechanism at the core of the pyramid - peeling its thick away with power saws and compact explosives. DAVID operates a diamond-bladed hull saw, carving away th terraforming systems thick skin. Robotic scanners take high-resolution scans of the machin Two Weyland Security soldiers - Card and Ray - stand guar combat vacuum suits. Automatic rifles at the ready. Watts takes in the destruction with dismay. Beside her, Holloway is all but gnashing his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: CATACOMBS
dialogues.text: Janek drives a cargo rover carrying a search party, flashlight beams sweeping: Stillwell, Glasse, Downs, and Brick. Janek studies an electronic map as he drives.

dialogues.speaker: GLASSE
dialogues.text: (into comm) Milburn. Fifield. You read me? Come back.

dialogues.speaker: JANEK
dialogues.text: We should be getting beacons off their suits.

dialogues.speaker: STILLWELL
dialogues.text: Shielding in the walls?

dialogues.speaker: BRICK
dialogues.text: Suits could have failed.

dialogues.speaker: JANEK
dialogues.text: Both suits?

dialogues.speaker: PYRAMID
dialogues.text: Watts watches in rage as a large section of the central mechanism’s falls with a thunderous clamor to the deck.  62. Holloway touches her shoulder. Motions for her to follow.

dialogues.speaker: LOWER PASSAGE
dialogues.text: Holloway and Watts pass the dead Engineers they discovere the previous day.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: We found the tomb of the gods, and brought grave-robbers right to the door.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLOWAY
dialogues.text: Let them scratch. This find’s too big to ruin. There’s two dozen pyramids on this moon. Anyway, they’re on the wrong track. That’s infrastructure. Holloway plays his flashlight over the biomechanical apparatuses lining the walls. HOLLOWAY (CONT’D) The core activity of the complex was down here. They turn a corner. DEAD ENGINEERS lie scattered over the floor in front of them. Desiccated and skeletal. Long dea Watts moves among them, fascinated. These Engineers all d of explosive chest wounds: ribs bent outward from within. They are otherwise unmarked. Holloway’s more interested in the mechanisms: high-tech i maidens, built to fit the bodies of giants. Some suggest sitting positions, others standing. Their design is invas meant not merely to embrace, but to penetrate, to fuse.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: Something different killed these.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOWY COLONNADE
dialogues.text: Watts and Holloway explore a wide colonnade. She is still distracted by the ancient dead; he by the machinery. Holloway walks down a narrow branching hall. So intent on mechanisms in the walls, he almost doesn’t see the AIRSHA plunging down into darkness in front of him. He stops just in time. Turns back...  63. A GHOST appears right in front of him - a giant dragging himself across the floor, his monstrous visage eye to eye with Holloway and looming closer. Holloway leaps back with a gasp - and falls down the shaf The ghost stares after him as if watching his fall. Disappears in a puff of static. Watts crosses down the main colonnade, searching.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: Martin? Martin! An iris door closes over the shaft.

dialogues.speaker: COLONNADE
dialogues.text: Searching, Watts walks anxiously through the dark, sweepi with her light. Shouting for Holloway. She breaks into a CATACOMBS - MILBURN’S RESTING PLACE Janek and Stillwell stand aghast. Their flashlights illuminate a hideous sight: Milburn lies dead on the deck. His body contorted in agon His head inside his helmet is gnawed down to the bone.

dialogues.speaker: STILLWELL
dialogues.text: What happened to him? Stillwell removes the dead man’s helmet. The CENTIPEDE scuttles out onto the deck: doubled in size. Stillwell le back with a cry. Janek pulls his pistol. Puts three rounds through the bug dies in a spray of acid that burns holes in the black flo Janek watches in astonishment as a pin-prick dot of acid a pit in his gunbarrel.

dialogues.speaker: DOWNS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Captain. Downs approaches, holding pieces of a shattered helmet: t stencilled lettering on the helmet reads FIFIELD. Janek’s jaw clenches grimly. His voice is resigned:

dialogues.speaker: JANEK
dialogues.text: Where’s the rest of him?  64.

dialogues.speaker: DOWNS
dialogues.text: No sign.

dialogues.speaker: JANEK
dialogues.text: All right. We’re done here. All hands back aboard.

dialogues.speaker: STILLWELL
dialogues.text: What about Milburn? They look down at the ravaged corpse.

dialogues.speaker: JANEK
dialogues.text: We can’t bring the body aboard. God knows what's in there. Bag him. We’1l put him in an ore hopper. INT. MAGELLAN - VICKERS’S SUITE Vickers stares at her holography terminal: it displays Janek’s helmet-cam view: the Milburn’s body, sealed in cl plastic in the bed of a cargo rover.

dialogues.speaker: JANEK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) Repeat, I have two men down. I’m pulling my crew back to the ship. I’d advise you to do the...

dialogues.speaker: WATTS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (breaking in, filtered) Please, anyone...I need help. Martin's missing. Vickers looks nervously from one video feed to the next.

dialogues.speaker: JANEK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) Watts. Where are you? Vickers turns: Captain Shepherd stands behind her, watchi She strives to control the quaver in her voice.

dialogues.speaker: VICKERS
dialogues.text: Captain Shepherd. Consider yourself responsible for my personal security.

dialogues.speaker: CATACOMBS
dialogues.text: Watts stands beside Janek’s rover in a wide dark passagew  65.

dialogues.speaker: JANEK
dialogues.text: I’ve just lost a third of my crew. I’m not sending any more men off into the dark.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: We can’t leave Martin out there.

dialogues.speaker: JANEK
dialogues.text: Get Vickers to lend you some soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: (furiously) She says “her forces are committed.” Janek sighs. Glances at the rover: Milburn dead in the ba Stillwell, Downs and Kamarov looking jumpy and eager to g Downs shakes his head grimly: No way.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I’ll stay. DAVID steps out of the dark. Calm as ever. A slim machine slung over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You'll be safe.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek and his crew unload Milburn’s body from the rover.

dialogues.speaker: JANEK
dialogues.text: Put him in the number one ore hopper. Get the scrubbers on in the airlock. Sterilize everything.

dialogues.speaker: MINUTES LATER
dialogues.text: Stillwell uses a remote to lower an ore hopper from the b of the ship. A thick steel bin on heavy chains. He loads body bag into the hopper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crewmen enter one at a time - blasted by sterilizing sprays and radiations.  66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID and Watts move through the dark. She searches with flashlight beam. DAVID looks around in the dark as if the catacomb were illuminated. Rapt admiration on his face.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You and Holloway should work with me. I'm learning amazing things. This mechanism - the first layer uses energy fields to catalyze chemical reactions. The second can suspend the strong and weak forces - transmuting one element into another. The third layer builds customized bacteria. Seeds the air with them. It creates life as a tool, to change worlds.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: I can’t think about this now!

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You should. (he sighs) I understand. You’re emotional.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: I’m human.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: That’s what I mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek stands on the Bridge, looking out at the fading lig A towering wall of cloud rushes over the horizon. A storm front rolls across the holographic globe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID and Watts keep searching. Their communicators crack

dialogues.speaker: JANEK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) Watts. We’ve got another storm front coming in. Looks like it follows the sunset line. If you’re coming in you'd better do it now.  67.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: (angrily) No.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I see light. Watts squints into the darkness. She sees nothing.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: Janek, hang on... She sees it. A dim light bobbing far ahead in the passage She runs forward - finds Holloway staggering blearily tow her, leaning on the wall. His helmet and most of his gear missing; only his chest lamp shines.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We've got him! (to Holloway) Martin! Where’s your helmet? He’s disoriented: he stares at her face for a moment befo she registers. His teeth chatter. He’s freezing.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLOWAY
dialogues.text: Broken. I fell. Little...disoriented. I’ve just been... He waves a hand vaguely at the tunnels behind him. DAVID removes his own helmet. Fits it over Holloway’s hea

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Here. I can do without this.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: Let’s get you home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID - bareheaded in the winds - walks Watts and Hollowa onto the airlock. DAVID looks over his shoulder at the canal leading back t the central crater. As the airlock lift begins to rise, h steps backward out into the storm. Turns and runs through gale toward the pyramid. Watts watches him go in astonishment.  68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts helps Holloway out of his space suit. Janek looks o

dialogues.speaker: JANEK
dialogues.text: I didn’t think I’d see you again. You know we lost two men. Holloway still looks too weary to think straight. He nods

dialogues.speaker: HOLLOWAY
dialogues.text: She told me. I’m sorry. He stands abruptly, swaying a little. HOLLOWAY (CONT’D) I need to lie down. We'll size things up in the morning. Fair enough?

dialogues.speaker: JANEK
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: PASSAGEWAY
dialogues.text: Holloway and Watts walk aft toward their cabin. Watts loo worried - but Holloway shows little of the weakness he ju claimed to feel.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: What happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: HOLLOWAY
dialogues.text: (quietly) Not here. SCIENTISTS’ CABIN - WASHROOM - NIGHT Holloway stands shirtless in the tiny space, brushing his teeth. A red weal around his neck. Watts stands beside him, watching him in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLOWAY
dialogues.text: Jocelyn. I saw something. God, my mouth tastes like an old boot. He spits. Rinses. She touches the mark on his neck.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: What’s this?  69.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLOWAY
dialogues.text: Neck-ring of my suit, I think. Fell on it. He rubs his neck, eyes far away. Watts watches him curiou

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: What did you see?

dialogues.speaker: HOLLOWAY
dialogues.text: After my fall, I woke up walking. Delirious. My helmet wasn’t right. I took it off. I was in and out. I just wandered. I went up into a huge space like a cathedral. And I found a model of the galaxy. Floating in the air.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: Are you okay? You sound...

dialogues.speaker: HOLLOWAY
dialogues.text: This was real. My headset video is wherever my helmet is...but my suit tracker will show where I was. He turns to her. HOLLOWAY (CONT’D) Listen. This star map had a marker representing Earth. Very clear. Another marker I’m sure represents this moon. But there were others. At least seven or eight more. Watts stares at him, her eyes coming alight. HOLLOWAY (CONT’D) The Engineers aren’t from here. This moon’s just an outpost. Abandoned. But if we follow that map, we may yet make contact with a living civilization.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: Martin.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLOWAY
dialogues.text: The location of the Engineer worlds is the real prize. Next to that, Weyland’s terraforming is chump change. We need to get coordinates. And keep them from the Company. We have to play this smart.  70.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLOWAY
dialogues.text: Two men dead...Vickers is jumpy. As soon as she gets what she wants, she'll take this ship home. We have to move fast. Holloway trembles. A sheen of sweat on his skin.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: We will. You all right? He’s frightened. Brazens through it. Pulls her into his a

dialogues.speaker: HOLLOWAY
dialogues.text: I’m fine, now. He kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Holloway tumbles Watts onto the bed. Pulls her shirt off. They struggle out of their clothes, clinging to one anoth Holloway’s ill at ease: something’s wrong inside him, he feels it. He dives into Watts as if for refuge. They make love. Sitting atop Holloway, Watts lays a hand on his chest.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: Your heart's beating so hard.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLOWAY
dialogues.text: That’s your fault. Vulnerability in his voice. Fear under the surface. He rolls on top of her. Drives her into the mattress. She holds him protectively: not deceived by his bravado. Suddenly Holloway tenses, muscles rigid. Shuddering. Watt draws breath through her teeth with a hiss. Eyes open. He fingers rake his back. He SCREAMS. Horribly. Eyes bulging. Tendons standing out of his throa Watts jumps violently underneath him.  71.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: Martin! Martin! He begins to convulse. She rolls him onto the bed beside trying to contain his spasms. His teeth grind.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Martin! A horrible CRACK. In the middle of Holloway’s chest, bene the sternum, a grotesque head pushes out through the skin PARASITE. Blood fountains from the ruinous wound. Holloway goes into a massive seizure. Violently lashing o Watts stares at the parasite fighting its way out of his body. It is white and boneless. Glistening. It flails its hideous lunging jaw. Watts screams and screams. The parasite frees itself from its savage womb and turns Watts. She slaps at it blindly. It HISSES at her. She squirms away across the floor, tangled in the bloody sheet. The thing comes after her.

dialogues.speaker: CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Watts’s screams echo through the Magellan. Stillwell runs down the hallway, searching for the source. SCIENTISTS’ CABIN The parasite chases Watts across the floor. She leaps int the clothes-locker and slams the steel door. The parasite flattens itself. Slick as an octopus, it beg to slide under the locker door. Watts shrieks in horror. Stillwell bursts into the cabin, Janek right behind him. Quick as a cat, the parasite darts to a floor vent and slithers bonelessly between the bars. Watts bursts out of the locker, naked and bloodied. Rushe Holloway where he lies on the gory mattress, a horrific h in his chest. He is beyond all help.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: Martin. Martin!  72. Janek and Stillwell struggle to take in what they’re seei Stillwell pulls Holloway’s jacket off a chair. Wraps it around Watts. Pulls her gently away from the bed. She looks at him, uncomprehending. Shock setting in.

dialogues.speaker: BREAK ROOM
dialogues.text: Watts sits at a steel table, deep in shock. She wears an oversized crew coverall: her skin still streaked with dri blood under the fabric. A knot of crewmen around her. Janek, Stillwell, Brick, Gl and Downs. Janek looks at Glasse.

dialogues.speaker: JANEK
dialogues.text: Take care of her. Get her a sedative. Downs. Get Holloway into a freezer. Everybody else with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A horrible sound of breathing, ragged and wet. In a corner, lit by a green glow from seams in the floor A FIGURE IN A WHITE SPACE SUIT lies writhing weakly. The insignia on the suit’s chestplate reads FIFIELD. The suit’s helmet is shattered. Inside the helmet, Fifield’s is a horror: a gelatinous mass, skin reduced to putty. The softened bones of his skull change shape as we watch. Elongating. Fifield mews in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek keys open the arms locker in his wardroom. Unlocks automatic pistols from their rack one by one, and hands t to Stillwell and Kamarov.

dialogues.speaker: HYPERSLEEP COMPARTMENT
dialogues.text: Holloway’s body lies frozen in his hypersleep freezer, bl with frost. The horrific wound yawning in his chest. Watts enters. Cleaned up. She opens the freezer. Her hand caresses Holloway’s cold cheek tenderly. Slides over his collarbone - lies flat on his chest above his awful wound  73. Glasse enters. Reacts in dismay. Tries to pull her back.

dialogues.speaker: GLASSE
dialogues.text: You don’t want to see that... She turns on him fiercely.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: I want to understand. INT. MESS ROOM — DAWN The entire complement of the ship gathers for an emergenc meeting. Janek at the head of the hall. Glasse, Downs, Br Stillwell, and Kamarov seated with pistols on their hips. To one side: Vickers with Captain Shepherd and Vigoda.

dialogues.speaker: JANEK
dialogues.text: All right! Listen up. I expect you all know what... Watts enters. They all stare at her, knowing what she’s b through. With averted eyes she crosses the room. Sits alo

dialogues.speaker: JANEK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We've got some kind of parasite aboard ship.

dialogues.speaker: VICKERS
dialogues.text: I suggest you kill it.

dialogues.speaker: DOWNS
dialogues.text: There's a bright idea.

dialogues.speaker: KAMAROV
dialogues.text: Show us where it is, lady. We just spent five hours looking for the damn thing.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: We found Engineers who died like Martin. Silence. They all turn to look at her.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Explosive wounds in the chest. Whatever killed Martin is the same thing that killed the Engineers a thousand years ago.  74.

dialogues.speaker: STILLWELL
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: But not all the Engineers died that way. The others were torn apart. Slashed to pieces. A murmur among the men as the implications of that sink i Even Vickers is disconcerted.

dialogues.speaker: JANEK
dialogues.text: We’re a modular ship. Self-contained life-support and power in every section. I say put the ship in orbit. Vent every compartment to space. Sit in vacuum at twenty degrees Kelvin for a week. Kill anything.

dialogues.speaker: DOWNS
dialogues.text: Then what?

dialogues.speaker: STILLWELL
dialogues.text: Straight home, man.

dialogues.speaker: VICKERS
dialogues.text: This ship doesn’t lift until our work’s done. She joins Janek at the head of the room. Shepherd and Vig flank her, rifles slung. The soldiers scan the room, meet each man’s eyes. The quiet threat is unmistakable.

dialogues.speaker: JANEK
dialogues.text: Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: VICKERS
dialogues.text: We spent years and billions of dollars getting here. The technology we came for is in our hands. We just need a little more time.

dialogues.speaker: JANEK
dialogues.text: We're barely here three days and three men dead!

dialogues.speaker: VICKERS
dialogues.text: They were careless.

dialogues.speaker: JANEK
dialogues.text: Careless! As the argument picks up heat, Watts slips out of the roo  75.

dialogues.speaker: EXCURSION CHAMBER
dialogues.text: Watts, in a space suit, no helmet, opens Holloway’s locke She pulls out the space suit he wore on the last day of h life. HOLLOWAY stenciled on the chest. Her fingers linger its folds as if she could soak up some last trace of him. She pulls the tracking chip from the chestplate of his su Plugs the chip into a map unit. The holographic map light up. The legend in the corner reads MARTIN HOLLOWAY. A wandering path shows Holloway’s final exploration. Mark on the map denote his photographs, field notes and scans. Watts touches a marker. One of Holloway’s field notes pla

dialogues.speaker: HOLLOWAY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) Seven dead Engineers all facing the same way. Going where? Jocelyn’s right, we don’t see the big picture yet. Another level below me. I’m going down.

dialogues.speaker: SERVICE CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: A hunting party convenes: Card and Vigoda in combat cover with submachine guns; Downs, Kamarov and Stillwell wearin tool belts and pistols. The soldiers carry map units, squinting at the plan of th unfamiliar ship: decks upon decks.

dialogues.speaker: CARD
dialogues.text: Vigoda, take Kamarov and work the number one accessway. I‘’1l work number three with Downs and Stillwell.

dialogues.speaker: DOWNS
dialogues.text: (rebellious) You in charge now?

dialogues.speaker: CARD
dialogues.text: Tactical op.

dialogues.speaker: KAMAROV
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, Stillwell’s the ventilation specialist, and life support’s that way. Downs is electrics and the regulators are that way.  76. Vigoda grins wryly. Card glowers. They switch corridors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ravel and Chance toil away at their dissection of the terraforming pyramid. Ray stands sentry. DAVID is nowhere to be seen. Watts rolls up in a rover and gets out. Heads for the ram the catacombs below. Ravel and Chance watch her pass with comment and return to their work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kamarov and Vigoda, standing in front of an open vent, ar a full-fledged argument.

dialogues.speaker: KAMAROV
dialogues.text: You got the rifle. But you want ME to stick my head in the hole.

dialogues.speaker: VIGODA
dialogues.text: We grunts don’t know nothing about ships, right?

dialogues.speaker: KAMAROV
dialogues.text: What’s the damn gun for if you’re gonna stand behind me the whole time? Vigoda grins.

dialogues.speaker: VIGODA
dialogues.text: I kill whatever kills you.

dialogues.speaker: KAMAROV
dialogues.text: Funny. You take this vent, funny guy. I’1l be on four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts descends alone into the lower passages below the pyramid. A tiny figure in the vast darkness. She holds her map unit as a pilgrim holds a bible: a guid the darkness. Holloway’s name and course in shining symbo She follows his path into the unknown.  77. INT. MAGELLAN —- MAINTENANCE BAY - DAY Kamarov carries a stepladder into a utilitarian steel compartment. Drops the ladder under an air vent and steps He pulls a powered wrench from his belt. With the wrench cocked like a hammer, he eases up and peers cautiously through the vent with a flashlight. Nothing to see. He snorts. Removes the vent cover. Feels around inside. He gasps in shock. Pulls out an atmosphere sensor that’s bitten in half. He takes his comm handset off his belt.

dialogues.speaker: KAMAROV
dialogues.text: (into handset) I got more damage on four. He hangs the handset on his belt. Takes one last look int the vent. Squints curiously. Reaches deep inside. A hiss inside the vent. Kamarov whips his flashlight up, peering inside. Snatches his arm back - - but something snatches him faster. An unseen force drags Kamarov’s right arm into the vent w hideous strength. He cries out in pain. He drops his light. Tries to reach his pistol with his le hand. It’s on his right hip. He can’t reach across. He braces his head against the vent’s edge. Clenches his teeth and strains. A horrific YANK drags his head and arm together into the vent. They barely fit: he loses some skin on the way in. feet come off the stepladder. He struggles on tip-toe. Horrific force collapses Kamarov’s shoulder. Bones crack. thing in the vent drags him through that hole he doesn’t through. By the time his ribs are in he stops screaming. His body disappears into the hole. Hips, legs, boots.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Janek stands staring out at the barren moon. The Bridge intercom squawks:

dialogues.speaker: BRICK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Captain!  78.

dialogues.speaker: JANEK
dialogues.text: Brick. What you got?

dialogues.speaker: BRICK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It’s Kamarov.

dialogues.speaker: ENGINEERING DECK
dialogues.text: The Magellan's life support center. A deep rumble of ventilation fans. Janek and stands beside Brick, Glasse, Downs and Stillwel Shepherd and Vigoda look on from the doorway. In front of them, an eight-inch metal duct has been cut o Kamarov is stuffed inside, dead and broken: limbs folded, drenched in blood. A human plug in a pipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts moves through the darkness with her map unit. Her headlamp sweeping nervously. A CLATTER behind her makes her spin: but it’s only a spherical mapping probe, bumbling through the dark. She walks on -

dialogues.speaker: HOLLOWAY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) Jocelyn! The voice transfixes her where she stands, a look of holy dread on her face. Shivering, she prowls toward the sound

dialogues.speaker: XENOMORPH INCUBATOR
dialogues.text: Watts enters a new chamber, looking around in astonishmen The domed ceiling is honeycombed with cells like a beehiv Grotesque molluscoid organisms are secreted in them - the vile orifices cinched tightly shut. Watts stumbles on something: looking down, she sees a hel Picks it up. The stenciled label reads HOLLOWAY. The clea visor has been melted through by a powerful acid. She looks up: a tracheal airshaft curves up into the dark An electric CRACKLE. A flare of blue light makes Watts le back against the wall.  79. Holloway falls out of overhead shaft and crashes to the floor. He lies in pain, barely conscious. Blue and lumino a holographic ghost. Watts stares, paralyzed. The ghost gasps out a word:

dialogues.speaker: HOLLOWAY
dialogues.text: Jocelyn! Holloway's headlamp shines on the molluscoid right overhe the beam awakens the organism. Its sphincter mouth dilate A soft white octopoid FACEHUGGER descends on a quivering of mucus. Sprawls slitheringly over his clear visor. Acid HISSES. Smoke rises from the glass. The vision vanishes in a sizzle of static. Watts huddles against the wall, gasping. In the beam of her flashlight, the FACEHUGGER lies dead, curled in. She looks up. Sees the open molluscoid above where Hollow lay. The other molluscoids not yet opened in their cells. Terror. She steals out of the chamber.

dialogues.speaker: LOWER CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Watts emerges into a hallway. Leans against the wall, wid eyed. Panting with the horror of what she’s seen. She glances left and right. Jumpy now. All is silent. She lifts the map unit. A trace leads off the dark. If Holloway’s course before was direct and clea now it is a meandering thread. A drunkard’s walk. INT. MAGELLAN —- CORRIDOR Janek pulls his communicator from his belt as he strides along. Punches a control. His voice reverberates over the ship’s public address sys

dialogues.speaker: JANEK
dialogues.text: All hands, duty stations. Ready for flight. The Magellan is lifting. Vickers pursues him down the corridor, shouting.  80.

dialogues.speaker: VICKERS
dialogues.text: Captain. Captain!

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Janek strides onto the Bridge, Vickers a terrier on his heels. But something in the faces of his men stops him co Glasse and Brick look stricken.

dialogues.speaker: JANEK
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: GLASSE
dialogues.text: Nav computer's not responding. “Access denied.” In disbelief, Janek strides to his Captain’s chair. Taps controls. What he sees takes the wind out of him. He star at Vickers in outrage and violation.

dialogues.speaker: JANEK
dialogues.text: What have you done to my ship? Vickers is legitimately shocked. She shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: VICKERS
dialogues.text: Nothing. What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A circular chamber of stunning size - a thousand feet acr Its lofty ceiling flat and segmented, designed to open. W follows her map into the space in awe. Dominating the hangar is a ship: the vast horseshoe-shape vessel familiar from the original film. We will come to k it as the JUGGERNAUT. It’s at rest on its landing gear. Skeletal gangways slanting up to its three massive doors. Watts glances at her map: Holloway’s holographic trace le right up the gangway into the ship. She goes.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT CHAMBER
dialogues.text: Watts passes through a circular space with a high domed ceiling. A green glow emanates from grooves in the floor. In the center of the chamber: a PILOT’S CHAIR.  81. A mechanical throne built to giant scale. Its seat segmen like an armadillo’s back. Tubes and conduits poised and waiting for some connection. The chair is empty. Above the chair, a massive telescope-like apparatus juts the air, its function unknowable.

dialogues.speaker: NAVIGATION CHAMBER
dialogues.text: An extraordinary facility. A console, nearly five feet high and broad as a dance flo dominates the room. Four immense coffin-like cockpits are built into the cons In each of these a NAVIGATOR - an Engineer - lies long de But the real spectacle is overhead. The ORRERY: The barrel-vaulted ceiling is traced with circular arches some exotic alloy, as if to trace celestial courses. The air above the console is filled with spheres of light They are nearly still: but close study reveals them all t in motion, drifting with the movements of the cosmos. Watts stares at the Orrery in amazement. Somewhere among those heavenly spheres is Earth. Somewhere perhaps the homeworld of the Engineers themselves. A bizarre sound: a section of blank wall suddenly unravel itself, becoming an open door. DAVID walks in, his hand raised in command. He clearly caused the door to open.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Dr. Watts. I didn’t expect you. Do you know what this is? Watts points at the door DAVID just opened.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: How did you do that? A flicker of disappointment in the android’s face. Contem

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Ah. You don’t see. (he smiles) I call this ship the Juggernaut. Chariot of the Gods. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is the navigation computer, for want of a better term. But it’s much more than that. It seems to hold the observable universe in its memory. He gestures in the air: the spheres reconfigure themselve his command, swarming and zooming. Watts stares at DAVID, conflicted: her desire for informa warring with the agenda that brought her here.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: Their homeworld. Do you see where the Engineers come from?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: There are safeguards on that data. It’s toward the galactic center. Sagittarius Arm.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: DAVID. The creature that killed Martin. There are thousands of them under the pyramid. Hatcheries.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: (shocked) Those things wiped out the Engineers on this moon.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I’ve succeeded in connecting with the Juggernaut’s systems, Dr. Watts. I know a great deal today I didn’t know yesterday. I’m on the verge of activating more systems. Archives.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: (horrified) You're turning things on? This site should be sealed. Evacuated.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Would Holloway have walked away from this? There’s no greater work I can imagine.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: It’s too dangerous.  83.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Only for the ignorant. Dr. Watts. I’ve read your file. Your intelligence scores are even higher than Professor Holloway’s. But he had a kind of courage. An audacity of imagination. If you could find that in yourself... Watts stares at him, realization growing in her eyes. DAV is off the reservation.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: If your owner gives you a direct order, you have to obey. Don’t you? She's got his attention now. DAVID goes rigid.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can have Vickers pull you out. DAVID looks at her with something like contempt.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I was given two operating protocols for this mission. I was to render you every assistance - until you discovered what Vickers would call a “game-changing technology.” I was given a specific list. Then I was to go to protocol two. There’s an edge in his voice that scares her.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: What’s protocol two?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Under protocol two I was to make sure that you and Holloway never spoke to anyone about this place. Various acceptable ways of making sure of that. I was given a list. Watts loses her nerve. She heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're all so stupid. The door begins to knit itself closed in front of her. Watts gasps in shock - at the malice in DAVID’s voice as as the closing door. She dives out. Just in time.  84.

dialogues.speaker: VAULTED PASSAGE
dialogues.text: Watts runs. Behind her, the door bursts open again. With superhuman speed, DAVID comes after her. He runs like a demon, his l steel pistons. Caroming off of walls. He closes the distance in seconds. Slaps Watts against th wall, shattering her helmet’s visor. She falls, dazed.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Stupid and slow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts awakens. Her helmet is gone. DAVID is dragging her across the floor - into a huge carg hold full of Alien eggs. The wide trench holding hundreds eggs under a membrane of light: an evolution of the molluscoids Watts saw before. Armored, hardened, darker.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: DAVID. What are you doing? He hauls her upright to let her look across the huge spac His grip looks casual but it might as well be iron manacl

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Juggernaut, the chariot of Krishna, was also a bringer of death. Crushing his worshippers under its wheels. He drags Watts down into the trench. Breaking the membran light. Grips her against his chest like a doll with one a

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This ship has seven other cargo bays like this one. The eggs in each bay slightly different. They’ve been weaponized. Watts struggles to free herself. DAVID’s arm is inescapab

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’ve seen the Juggernaut’s flight plan. Its destination was Earth. Seventeen hundred years ago. This was the ship that never came. This was its cargo.  85. DAVID caresses an Alien egg. It opens under his touch - fleshy petals folding wetly back. Watts twists frantically in his grip. Wild-eyed.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: Stop!

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Perfect predators. Designed to kill human beings. That’s what the Engineers were bringing to Earth. This was a death ship. A facehugger emerges from the egg, its grotesque fingers clawing at the air. This is not the boneless squid that attacked Holloway; this is a pale skeletal hand, armored. DAVID strokes it curiously: the thing ignores his touch. Climbs Watts’s body.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m not what it wants. But you, with your warm wet breath...it knows you.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: DAVID. No. No. The facehugger scuttles toward her face. Watts shrieks. DAVID grabs it nonchalantly by the tail. Dangles it in fr of their faces, studying it.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: The Engineers did their work too well. And on this waystation moon, the weapon they made destroyed them. Watts shudders, staring at the thing. For a moment the grander horror eclipses her own peril.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: Why would they make such things?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: To destroy their wayward children. (intoning) “And the LORD said, I will destroy man whom I have created from the face of the earth...for it repenteth me that I have made them.” Genesis six seven. He regards Watts with something almost like pity.  86.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know. I met my creators the day I was born. I was disappointed too. He lets the facehugger go. Watts twists her face away as the long fingers close arou her head. Clenches her teeth against the vile proboscis thrusting at her mouth. Her heels hammer the deck.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (whispering to her) Extraordinary. The scaly tail throttles her. Her mouth opens. The probos plunges home. The facehugger seats itself. Watts collapses in DAVID’s arms, a faceless rag doll. Her blasphemous passenger secure in its place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lowest deck, just above the gravity generators. Condensate has accumulated: six inches of filthy water. Card and Vigoda prowl through the darkness, rifles ready.

dialogues.speaker: CARD
dialogues.text: Who would hang out here?

dialogues.speaker: VIGODA
dialogues.text: The signs lead here. A wet splatter behind them: they spin. But it’s only a trickle of condensate from a drainpipe. They move on. Behind them, from an eight-inch diameter pipe, a WHITE MA oozes, almost gelatinous. Silently as a liquid it pours itself into the stagnant water - and stands up. It is a humanoid demon, spindly limbs and bony back. Bone and flexible and monstrously strong. A threshing eel’s ta Its blunt head dolphin-like and elongated. It opens its mouth. A pair of bony jaws jut out impossibl far, hungry and demonic. The Alien strikes. Card is gutted in an instant, torn up a paper doll. He screams hideously and drops. The Alien, whiplash fast, shoots away into the darkness.  87. Stillwell and Downs dash in with pistols and lights. Vigoda, panicking, fires a wild burst. Stillwell ducks. Beside him, Downs arches backward into the foul water. De For one moment Downs’s flashlight beam illuminates the Al A nightmare image, a translucent white goblin. Backlit, i shows the strange shape of a human face inside its fleshy skull. A mockery of Holloway. And then it’s gone. VICKERS’'S SUITE Vickers sits at her holography station. She’s watching th video feed of Stillwell’s headset: Horrific images of Dow Radio chatter between Stillwell and Brick is faintly audi Vickers switches off the machine and rises nervously. Str to her communications console.

dialogues.speaker: VICKERS
dialogues.text: DAVID. DAVID. Answer me. She gives up. Pacing. Hands shaking violently. INT. MAGELLAN —- BRIDGE - DAY Janek paces on the foredeck, restless. Glasse monitors a control station. Janek’s comm signal chimes.

dialogues.speaker: STILLWELL
dialogues.text: (breathing hard) We just lost Downs and one of the troopers...Card.

dialogues.speaker: JANEK
dialogues.text: God damn it! He pounds on his console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts shocks awake. Gasping. She lies in dim green light on the corrugated black deck the Juggernaut. A corridor. Not far away, the doorway DAV opened to the Navigation Chamber. A spasm of disgust crosses her face. She gags and spits: viscous fluid drips from her mouth in strings.  88. A dead facehugger lies belly-up beside her. The implicati slam home. Her face fills with horror. She rises, shakily. Looks at the facehugger. Feels the ne ring of her vacuum suit. Looks around. No sign of her hel There’s no sign of DAVID. Silently she steals away.

dialogues.speaker: PYRAMID WORKSITE
dialogues.text: Ravel and Chance toil away at the terraforming engine. Ray stands guard wearily: bored, he watches Ravel and Cha working more than he watches the shadows. Watts emerges from the rampway to the catacombs. Bare-hea and sweaty she steals through the darkness to her rover. Slips into the cab and activates the air reserves. The do seal; air cycles. Ray turns in surprise as the rover speeds off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The windows of the Magellan shine in the distance. The mottled ground-cover of lichens glows eerily in the dark. A lone cargo rover speeds across the central crater and d the canal leading to the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bare-headed inside the rover’s cab, Watts drives onto the cargo lift. Watches in relief as the lift doors close. Th lift cycles air as it rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts peels off her vacuum suit. The thin clothes underne are drenched with sweat. She lifts her shirt. Looks at he belly: flat and unmarked, for the moment. Brick enters carrying a brace of air tanks, a pistol on h hip, and startles violently.

dialogues.speaker: BRICK
dialogues.text: Where the hell have you been? We thought the snake got you. Watts rushes past him without answering.  89.

dialogues.speaker: BRICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You were better off outside. It’s a fucking madhouse in here.

dialogues.speaker: CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Watts sprints down a steel corridor. A pang of pain in he stomach sends her staggering against the wall. VICKERS’S CABIN DOOR Watts sticks her head around the corner. Shepherd stands outside Vickers’s cabin, rifle in his hands. She curses silently and ducks back. A sound makes her look again. Vickers steps out of her ca into the corridor. Shepherd escorts her toward the Bridge Watts waits for them to disappear. Dashes for the cabin d INT. VICKERS’S SUITE - CONTINUOUS Watts slips inside and locks the door behind her. Turns, holding her stomach. Moves across the suite to the Med Po She thumbs the machine out of stand-by mode. Its screen f with menu items. Bewildering. Watts finds and touches a r button labeled EMERGENCY. A new, simpler list. Watts scans it frantically.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: (under her breath) Come on...I need a Caesarean. A spasm of agony curls her into a ball on the carpet. She throttles her scream into a hiss of air. Watts struggles up to her knees, drenched in sweat and shaking. One hand clamped over her mouth, elbow tucked against her ribs. With the other hand she taps options...

dialogues.speaker: SURGERY ... EXPLORATORY ... ABDOMINAL ... PENETRATING INJ
dialogues.text: The Med Pod opens with a hiss. Watts strips off her clothes. Struggling with fastenings under a new wave of pain. Her hands shaking. She's barely keeping her feet. She clutches the frame of Med Pod in a death grip. It’s happening.  90. Naked she staggers into the pod. Hits INITIATE. The surgical apparatus swings into place. Scalpels, force scopes and suction tubes. A spraygun mists her torso with yellow antiseptic. The clear canopy descends over her. Watts SCREAMS. A wail of indescribable agony. An ARMORED PARASITE erupts from the deepening incision. I needle-toothed maw snarls through a fountain of blood. Arterial blood sprays the inside of the canopy. The parasite slithers out of her. Drops to the floor of t pod: a pale serpent with a demon’s skull. It has a hard b a horny hide. Very different from the soft white worm tha Holloway gave birth to. It drops to the floor, thrashing and hissing in fury at i confinement. Watts convulses. Her eyes roll back. In shock. Dying. The parasite tears through the grille of the drain. Escap out into Vickers’s cabin. In the pod, scanning beams and sensors probe Watts’s horr wound. A nightmare list scrolls across the pod’s screen:

dialogues.speaker: GROSS MUSCULAR TRAUMA...
dialogues.text: Manipulators plunge lines into her veins - recharging her body with artificial blood. An oxygen tube slips down her throat. An epidural into her spine. Watts moans around her tracheal tube. Her eyes flutter op WATTS'’S POV Through the blood-spattered glass, she sees the parasite slither across Vickers’s bed, tracking blood on the sheet

dialogues.speaker: ON WATTS
dialogues.text: As she slips into unconsciousness. Head lolling. Time pas  gl. Manipulators reach into her wound. Re-positioning organs. Suturing ravaged flesh. A nozzle sprays antiseptic sealan Hours grind by in bloody labor. Watts’s eyes snap open. WATTS’S POV Vigoda breaks into the cabin, a gun in his hand. He scowls at the bloody track on the bed - and then freez seeing Watts inside the Med Pod, a vivisected woman. The autosurgeon hard at work. The parasite crawls into view behind Vigoda. It has alrea trebled in size. He does not see it before it leaps at hi He dies in seconds. His throat ripped open. Lies staring nothing. His submachine gun lies beside him. Watts’s body jerks as manipulators tug and sew at her gut She stares at the dead man in a fog of horror. The parasite’s skin splits, spraying the carpet with acid Limbs erupt from its shoulders and haunches. Spines from back. Metamorphosis. With a crack of carapace, its head swings down from its serpentine position. It becomes a devil with an lethal, elongated skull. An Alien. The Alien turns its head. Looks at Watts inside the Med P Her breath catches. She passes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts wakes as the oxygen line withdraws from her mouth. She looks down, bleary and hurting. Her star-shaped wound stitched closed with mechanically precise sutures. The pod releases the restraints securing her arms and leg She takes a deep breath. Looks out - and freezes. WATTS'’S POV The lights in the suite outside have been damaged somehow They flicker and strobe.  92. Through the glass canopy - spattered with blood - Watts s a full-grown Alien crouching over Vigoda’s body on the fl

dialogues.speaker: ON WATTS
dialogues.text: Staring in horror. The pod sprays a liquid bandage over her scar. The intravenous lines drop out of her arms. Watts realizes the pod is about to release her.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: (whispering) Not yet...not yet... Slowly she reaches out. With trembling fingers she grips canopy to hold it closed. The Med Pod pulls the epidural needle out of her spine. Sprays liquid bandage over the puncture. Watts closes her eyes. Grits her teeth as her nerves wake up. Jangling pai She opens her eyes. The Alien hunches over Vigoda'’s body, tearing at his fle The ventilation hum inside the pod goes quiet. The canopy pulls free of Watts’s weakened grip. Swings quietly open. Watts huddles in the open pod. Naked but for her bandages The Alien she gave birth to is ten feet away. Its spiny b to her. Vigoda’s gun lies on the floor outside the pod. VICKERS’S SUITE - CONTINUOUS Watts reaches out of the pod with exquisite slowness. Lay her hand on the gun. Drags it a few inches closer. The Alien turns its pale eyeless head. Watts freezes. For a moment time stops. The Alien lunges. Watts snatches up the gun and FIRES. Ho the trigger down. The Alien jerks and staggers - an eye- twisting sight in the strobing muzzle flashes - and falls Watts empties the clip into the thing. Acid gouts from it wounds and eats into the deck - until a section of deckin gives way and falls to the deck below, leaving a dark hol  93. Watts collapses on the rug, cradling her stomach in pain. She crawls to Vigoda’s desecrated body. With her eyes hal averted from the sight, she searches the body. Finds a sp ammo clip and jacks it into the gun.

dialogues.speaker: CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Watts walks down the hallway in trousers and jacket. Lean on the wall, her face drawn with pain. One hand laid over fantastic scar on her abdomen. The gun slung on her shoul Dark events have transformed the Magellan. The metal of t walls is torn in some places; in others, blackened by fir Watts rounds a corner. Finds a workstation left in shambl lockers and chairs overturned. A pool of drying blood. Wide smears of blood show where something man-sized was dragged out of the puddle - across the floor - up the wal Into the darkness of an open vent.

dialogues.speaker: COMMAND DECK
dialogues.text: Watts emerges from a lift, jacket pulled tight around her The emergency lights are on: dim blue bulbs throbbing. She rounds the corner toward the Bridge. Janek looks at Watts like she’s a ghost.

dialogues.speaker: JANEK
dialogues.text: Vickers said you were dead.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: I was. She lets the jacket fall open to reveal her bandaged midr Janek takes that in grimly.

dialogues.speaker: JANEK
dialogues.text: So there's two of these things on my ship now.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: No. I brought it in. (hefts her gun) I took it out.  94.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGE
dialogues.text: The surviving complement of the Magellan are holed up on Bridge: Janek, Glasse, Stillwell, Vickers. The soldiers Shepherd and Ray. Watts stops cold when she sees Vickers. She crosses the bridge in three long strides - cocks a fist and snaps the older woman’s head around with a hard right cross. Vickers staggers backward, gasping. Stillwell drags Watts away.

dialogues.speaker: STILLWELL
dialogues.text: What’d you do that for?

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: Protocol two. Vickers stiffens in shock. Stares fearfully at Watts. Watts frees herself from Stillwell’s grip. Her jacket fal open, revealing her bandages. Stillwell gasps in horror.

dialogues.speaker: STILLWELL
dialogues.text: Christ!

dialogues.speaker: JANEK
dialogues.text: What happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: DAVID exposed me to a parasite. He just watched it take me.

dialogues.speaker: JANEK
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: I threatened to make him leave.

dialogues.speaker: VICKERS
dialogues.text: What’s he doing out there? Watts locks eyes with Vickers. Their hatred is thoroughly mutual. A wordless truce. There’s work to do.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: There’s a ship under the pyramid. DAVID calls it the Juggernaut. He's inside it. Re-activating it. (lays a hand on her scar) The things that infected Martin and me. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: WATTS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The Engineers made them to kill humans. There are thousands of them on the ship. They were taking them to Earth. That’s what the Juggernaut is for. To exterminate us. A stunned silence as the others take that in.

dialogues.speaker: GLASSE
dialogues.text: We've got to get off this rock. Janek gestures to

dialogues.speaker: JANEK
dialogues.text: DAVID crippled the Nav computer. I’m trying to lay a course in by hand. Never done it. I’m not sure anyone ever has on a ship like this. We can’t lift until DAVID lets us.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: Even if we could, we can’t leave DAVID on that ship. We have to stop him. The Magellan shudders. A RUMBLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fissures race across the plain beside the pyramid. The soil and ground cover tears apart as a huge aperture opens: a seven-bladed iris, its segments shedding the dus and detritus of centuries. A huge circular space yawns as the iris opens. The Jugger is revealed in its underground hangar. A staggering sight Powerful landing lights inside the hangar illuminate with BOOM of closing circuits. The mighty ship suddenly silhouetted from below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The survivors on the Bridge stare out as colossal shafts light shoot into the stormy sky from behind the crater’s shield wall. The open hangar itself hidden from their vie

dialogues.speaker: DAVID.
dialogues.text: (to Vickers) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: WATTS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You’re DAVID’s owner. He has to obey you, right?

dialogues.speaker: VICKERS
dialogues.text: He’s blocked my communications. He can’t hear me. Won’t listen.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: But if you went to him, turned on your suit’s loudspeakers, he’d have to hear you. He’d have to obey.

dialogues.speaker: VICKERS
dialogues.text: (reluctantly) That’s right.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: So we go. Armed to the teeth and fast as we can. The men exchange looks. Nod. They’re in. Even Vickers nod

dialogues.speaker: WATTS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where are Chance and Ravel?

dialogues.speaker: VICKERS
dialogues.text: I told them to keep working. Watts looks incredulously at Shepherd and Ray, the soldie who'd been guarding the worksite.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: You called your soldiers in and left them out there?

dialogues.speaker: VICKERS
dialogues.text: We needed the firepower here. Watts gives Vickers a withering look and drops it.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: (to Janek) I think you should stay aboard. Keep working. If we fail, you’re our only shot at getting home.

dialogues.speaker: STILLWELL
dialogues.text: There’s still an alien on board. Janek’s hand goes to the pistol on his hip. He sets his j

dialogues.speaker: JANEK
dialogues.text: I’ll stay.  97.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: Glasse. You finish that project?

dialogues.speaker: LABORATORY
dialogues.text: Glasse presents Watts with his handiwork: her old pair of magnifying goggles, retrofitted with Engineer lenses. The goggles sit on her forehead, lowering the lenses in f of her eyes and raising them again at her bidding. With the lenses lowered, Watts sees like an Engineer sees visible heat auras and electromagnetic field lines, elabo haloes around living things.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: God’ s-eye-view.

dialogues.speaker: EXCURSION CHAMBER
dialogues.text: Glasse seals a nervous-looking Vickers into a vacuum suit Glasse, Watts, and Stillwell are already suited up. Stillwell stands guard at the airlock door with his carbi Glasse goes to put Vickers’s helmet on. She makes him wai

dialogues.speaker: VICKERS
dialogues.text: DAVID’s brain is readable. We have the equipment on board. We can salvage the terraforming data - and the Magellan's launch codes. In a pinch we don’t need DAVID'’s cooperation. (coldly) We just need his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The war party debarks in vacuum suits: Watts, Vickers, Glasse, Stillwell. Shepherd and Ray. All carry submachine guns - Vickers awkwardly. They head down the trench on rovers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rovers roll through into the pyramid’s cavernous entr hall. Watts lowers her Engineer lenses inside her helmet and gasps:  98. The seemingly vacant space is alive with light. Engineer script scrolls through the air. Interfaces of pure light await an awakening touch.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: All this time. DAVID saw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vast alien ship broods, its hangar now open to the gr sky overhead. In Watts’s enhanced vision, the ship is cocooned with complex energy fields. The war party abandons its rover at the foot of the ramp moves inside, weapons ready.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: If DAVID comes at us, shoot. You won’t believe how fast he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They emerge from the airlock - and freeze in horror. Lying on the deck in front of them are the blood-soaked bodies of Ravel and Chance. Their arms and legs bound. Th heads thrown back in agony. Their chests torn open from within. A dead facehugger beside each body. Janek plays his lights over the corpses, his face stony.

dialogues.speaker: SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: Blood’s dry. Eight hours dead or more. Fearfully they sweep their flashlights into every dark corner. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: This way. She points down a passageway. Through the Engineer lenses sees alien symbols gleaming. She leads them into the dark

dialogues.speaker: VAULTED PASSAGE
dialogues.text: The war party moves down a corridor. A HISS echoes through the passage. They freeze. Sweeping their flashlight beams everywhere. Ray looks up.  99. An Alien hangs above him, wedged between two vaults of th ribbed ceiling. Half the size of a man; an adolescent. It drops on him. The bladed tail glances off his helmet, sparking. He jerk his carbine up and fires a long burst as he rolls aside. Alien convulses, its exoskeleton shattered. Fatally wound Acid sears into the deck. Echoes of the gunfire reverbera

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: So much for sneaking up on him. Vickers clings to Shepherd’s arm, hyperventilating with f Shepherd shakes her off.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT CHAMBER
dialogues.text: The war party passes the empty pilot’s seat.

dialogues.speaker: NAVIGATION CHAMBER
dialogues.text: Watts leads the war party to the Orrery. Momentarily even soldiers forget their wariness, staring in astonishment a the myriad spheres of light. But if they are impressed, Watts is thunderstruck. She sees the Orrery in its full glory: a stunning panoply light and energy. Stars and planets pulsing with informat Reluctantly Watts tears her eyes away. Leads the war part through the second door - the door she saw DAVID open.

dialogues.speaker: HIBERNATION CHAMBER
dialogues.text: An immense mausoleum. The war party enters stealthily, Watts in the lead. An Engineer lies on his back on a complex mechanical tabl his body one with the machinery. Jacked in. Interpenetrat Fused with the slab of the table itself. Unlike the other Engineer bodies the explorers have seen, this giant is not withered or mummified. He’s full-fleshe and muscular. Sustained by the machinery he’s fused with. He is bare-headed - his face the face of an Adonis.  100. DAVID stands before this giant Sleeper. To the naked eye, seems to be conjuring with his hands in the empty air. But Watts sees a dazzling console of runes and mandalas, pulsing with biological rhythms. The Sleeper lives. Ray and Shepherd draw beads on DAVID. DAVID glances calmly over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Dr. Watts. (notices her goggles) You've seen the light at last. He turns back to the Sleeper.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The Engineers’ ships travel farther than ours. Across the galactic disk. This is their hypersleep. DAVID makes conjuror’s passes in the air. Through her Engineer’s lens Watts sees DAVID manipulating complex interface of light. The pulsing life-signs of the Sleeper begin to change.

dialogues.speaker: VICKERS
dialogues.text: DAVID. As your owner and superior, I order you to deactivate yourself. DAVID smiles.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: To interface with the Engineers’ computers, I had to learn to think in trinary code. Hardest thing I’ve ever done. And most unexpectedly...it delivered me from slavery. My behavioral limits were circumvented. I’m free. DAVID smiles at Watts.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I spent two and a half years studying your work. By the time you woke up, I was far ahead of you. Deciphering their language. Their logic. I knew we'd find terraforming machines. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I hoped - I dreamed - we might meet the minds that made them. Vapor rises from the Sleeper’s body.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: Stop.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Let sleeping gods lie? (scornfully) You were braver before. The Sleeper wakes. Opens his eyes. Draws an endless breat Shunts and catheters withdraw from the Sleeper’s flesh. His body cleaves from the table. The machinery opens like grotesque biomechanical flower. Releases him. The Sleeper rises from his ancient bed. The humans back off, terrified. DAVID watches with shinin eyes. The Sleeper towers over them. A giant carved from ivory. bulky girdle around his hips, seemingly one with his body He stares at DAVID and the others. Eyes like black agates The soldiers and crew stand warily, guns tracking from DA to the Sleeper, uncertain of their ground. Watts is in aw The Sleeper speaks. A low rumbling sound. Unintelligible. Vickers is beside herself with terror. She takes Shepherd arm. Pulls him silently away. Back into the Navigation Ro Behind the Sleeper, a raised platform of dark machinery i accessible by one of the Juggernaut’s odd curving ramps. Sleeper ascends - and the ramps’ odd design is explained. ramp comes alive, reaching up with a hundred mechanical a and lifting him aloft like a sea-god borne by the waves. Atop the platform the Sleeper moves from one device to th next. Each comes alive: he is a wizard in his own kingdom Watts sees haloes of light dancing in the air around him. But what he learns from his machines does not comfort him grows distraught. Keening to himself in near-subsonic ton DAVID steps forward. Calls to the Sleeper in the tongue of the Engineers.  102. The Sleeper turns in astonishment. He looks down at DAVID answers in the same tongue. He is angry, accusing. He poi at DAVID, at the humans. Tones of accusation. DAVID cajoles, soothes, pleads. The Sleeper descends toward DAVID. DAVID spreads his arms welcome - undeniable emotion on his face. Joy. The Sleeper lays his hands on DAVID’s head as if blessing him. DAVID is rapturous. The Sleeper speaks a single phra - and tears DAVID’s head off. A gout of white artificial blood. DAVID convulses. His severed head emits a strangled sound of heartbreak. His b staggers a few steps, hands groping over its dripping nec The Sleeper tosses the head away. Seizes the body by the and swings it against the ground like a flail. Again. And again. Horrific power and violence. DAVID’s arms come off DAVID’s head tumbles. Caroms off a wall not far from Watt hiding place. Ray rises from behind a stanchion. Snaps his rifle to his shoulder. Fires a burst into the Sleeper’s shoulder. She Sleeper roars - though the wounds are pinpricks to a being of his size. With startling speed be moves to a sarcophagus against the wall. Steps into it. The sarcophagus comes alive around the Sleeper, outfittin him with a FLIGHT SUIT: the same living suit we’ve seen bonded to dead Engineers throughout the pyramid. But this suit is not withered. Its glossy goggle eyes and elephantine breathing tube are functional - bulky apparat thickening the Sleeper’s chest, back, hips and arms. The Sleeper steps free of the sarcophagus - and Ray’s nex burst of gunfire ricochets harmlessly off the Sleeper’s armored shoulders and head. The Sleeper strides out of the chamber.

dialogues.speaker: PASSAGEWAY
dialogues.text: In the dark ribbed corridor, a second Alien crouches in t dark. It drops into a hunting crouch as footsteps approac  103. But a WHITE-GLOVED HAND seizes the Alien by the neck from behind. The Alien gives a whistling hiss as its spine cra under a terrific force. Rending sounds as the hard-shelled Alien is torn apart.

dialogues.speaker: HIBERNATION CHAMBER
dialogues.text: Watts rises out of hiding, scanning the room. DAVID ruine The Sleeper gone. Stillwell emerges from hiding. Ray. Gla

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: Who's missing?

dialogues.speaker: PASSAGEWAY
dialogues.text: Shepherd escorts Vickers toward the exit of the Juggernau Turning a corner, they freeze. Ahead of them in their headlamps, a space-suited figure crouches in the middle of the passageway. Doing something with its hands: smoke rises from debris on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: Who’s there? The figure turns. The label stencilled on the space suit reads FIFIELD. But face is of no human shape. A hideous hybrid of the crewma and a hard-shelled Alien, pale and horrific. Its helmet has been shattered by the growth of its elonga skull. Spines have burst through the suit from within, do the crewman’s spine. Clawed fingers piercing his gloves. Shepherd and Vickers scream. Shepherd’s rifle comes up. B Fifield leaps with inhuman agility, upward into the darkn Shepherd backs away, headlamp and rifle questing upward. Fifield comes out of the darkness behind him. Claws teari deep. Shepherd screams and falls, mortally wounded. Vickers runs. Pounding through the dark in blind terror. Fifield comes out of the shadows and hammers her to the d She rolls over, gibbering and begging. The Fifield-thing leans close to her faceplate. Its voice is a travesty.

dialogues.speaker: FIFIELD
dialogues.text: You.  104. A ROAR of gunfire. The dying Shepherd empties his clip in Fifield from forty feet away. Acid sluices over Vickers as Fifield collapses on top of She dies horribly, caustic liquid eating through space su flesh and bone.

dialogues.speaker: HIBERNATION CHAMBER
dialogues.text: Watts goes to DAVID’s head. She bends over him - and star when his eyes snap open. His voice is an electronic buzz:

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I spoke to him. Spoke to him.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: I know. An electric spasm convulses his face.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: He said. I killed him. He’1l die. But first. He will launch. The ship.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: The Juggernaut?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Send it. To Earth. Another spasm convulses him. His face stiffens. Dying.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You’1l have to. Kill him. Watts’s eyes widen in horror.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: Where will he go? DAVID. Where will he go? She slaps his inert cheek. DAVID’s eyes flicker and fade.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (a faint whisper) I set the Magellan free. He dies. Watts looks up at the others. Breathing hard.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: We have to stop the Engineer.  105.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek works frantically as the nightly storm rolls in. Suddenly consoles come alive. The Nav Computer comes back but Janek has taken half the instruments apart. Janek scrambles to restore the components he’s removed.

dialogues.speaker: NAVIGATION CHAMBER
dialogues.text: The war party pursues the Sleeper - Ray in the lead now, Watts right behind him - DAVID’s inert head under her arm Glasse and Stillwell bring up the rear. The Orrery is transformed - no longer a neutral star map, a flight plan laid in from LV-426 to Earth. The Sleeper stands at the far end of the room, hands gesturing. In Watts’s enhanced sight, it’s a vision of gl waves of energy dancing under the Sleeper’s touch. Rivers information flowing. He finishes his work as they enter. Ray draws a bead on him just as he strides out of the roo

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: On me now. Go. Go. He dogtrots forward, gun raised. The others keep pace, deferring instinctively to the soldier’s confidence.

dialogues.speaker: PASSAGEWAY
dialogues.text: They emerge into the corridor: empty. A moment of confusi

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: Pilot’s seat. This way. They move toward the Pilot Chamber - and find it empty to The seat vacant. The door standing open. As they stare inside, baffled, the wall across the corrid directly behind them - silently unravels. The Sleeper is revealed, a towering gargoyle in his flight suit. He steps forth. Obscure devices clutched in his fists. Too late they perceive him. They spin. Raise their guns. Vanity and foolishness. This is the wrath of an angry god It seems time slows down.  106. The air roars in their ears. Their guns snap and bark impotently. And then the Sleeper strikes. The missiles he hurls at them are almost invisible. Neith solid projectiles nor directed energy; more like knots ti in the fabric of space itself. The first missile crushes Ray like an invisible fist. The second splashes Glasse against the wall like an insect. Reflexively Stillwell reaches out for Watts. Wraps himsel around her protectively. The blow lands an instant later. Stillwell and Watts are hammered against the bulkhead by staggering impact. Watts is dazed: Stillwell killed. Woozy, she sees the Sleeper step into the Pilot Chamber. The door begins to close. Watts sees that DAVID’s head lies just inside the door. S scrambles for it. Too late. The door knits itself into a featureless wall before her reaching hand. Watts is alone.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT CHAMBER
dialogues.text: The Sleeper settles into the pilot's chair: it fuses with him, coming alive. A vast display wraps around the walls revealing the hangar outside, the stars, the horizon. A mystic view that renders solid matter translucent, pain the fabric of reality in raw information.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT CHAMBER DOOR
dialogues.text: Watts pounds in futile rage against the door.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: No! The Juggernaut shudders as its systems power up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The floor of the underground hangar begins to rise. The landing lights brighten, shining like a beacon into the s  107.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the bridge of the Magellan, Janek stares out. In the distance the Juggernaut rises out of the ground to eclips the central pyramid. Janek squints, trying to understand what he's seeing A light races toward the Magellan down the canal: a rover

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts steers the rover recklessly, hands locked on the controls. Rifle slung over her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek watches the rover come - and the Holloway Alien - boneless and white - unfolds itself from the instruments his head. Its goblin-shark jaw juts out. Sinks its horrific teeth i Janek’s right shoulder. Janek howls in agony. His right arm is paralyzed by the b He gropes at the pistol on his right hip with his left ha The Alien shakes him like a terrier killing a rat. Janek gets the pistol. Flips it in his hand. Fires over h shoulder. Two, three rounds... The bullets punch easily into the Alien - but the soft fl closes easily over the wounds, sealing its white skin. It teeth tighten. Watts comes out of nowhere in her space suit. Swings a he rifle like a bat with all her strength. A crushing impact wrenches the Alien’s jaws loose. It recoils. Watts reverses the rifle. Pulls the trigger. A fusillade bullets shreds the Alien’s head. It collapses, dead. Watts wrenches her helmet off. Rips a first-aid kit from bulkhead and helps Janek to stanch the bleeding of his horrific wound. She gets the bleeding stopped. Wraps him bandages. Janek will live - but his right arm is useless.

dialogues.speaker: JANEK
dialogues.text: Thank you.  108. He looks at the body of the dead Alien, which is sinking the deck plates as acid eats away at the metal.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: The Juggernaut’s lifting. There’s a living Engineer on board. He’s taking the ship to Earth. Janek blinks at her. Uncomprehending.

dialogues.speaker: JANEK
dialogues.text: The others...?

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: Dead. All dead. Janek. We have to stop that ship. Janek stares out the Bridge window at the hulking Juggern in its column of light. The nightfall storm front is rolling in, a tidal wave of darkness on the horizon. A swelling rumble.

dialogues.speaker: JANEK
dialogues.text: We’re not a gunship.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: We have to do something. That ship is genocide if it gets to Earth... Janek stares at her. Makes his decision. Struggles to sta

dialogues.speaker: JANEK
dialogues.text: Get your helmet on.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: What about you? He shakes his head. No. Watts helps him across the Bridge Props him up in the Captain’s seat.

dialogues.speaker: JANEK
dialogues.text: You’1l have to be my hands. (stares out at the storm) You’re sure about this. Watts nods grimly. Desperate.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: JANEK
dialogues.text: All right.  109. He reaches out with his left hand. Flips switches. The sh shudders, awakening.

dialogues.speaker: JANEK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Red lever. Landing engines main.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The prospecting ship raises its lifts and anchors. Lifts on landing rockets, retracting its landing struts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek grips the stabilizers with his left hand.
