dialogues.speaker: JANEK
dialogues.text: Take the stick. Throttle up, stick forward. Watts sends the Magellan careening toward the Juggernaut just as the Juggernaut begins to float off the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Magellan barrels toward the Juggernaut, skimming the ground, as the storm wall sweeps closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the Juggernaut's pilot chair, the Sleeper sees them coming. His thoughts quicken. An explosion of light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Juggernaut leaps into the sky. The Magellan roars through the cyclone of dust in its wak Barely avoids the pyramid. Rakes around in a screaming tu and climbs in pursuit, engines howling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek and Watts strain at the controls together.

dialogues.speaker: JANEK
dialogues.text: Stick back! Hard!  110.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: (screaming) I am!

dialogues.speaker: JANEK
dialogues.text: Harder! The Magellan rolls into a howling climb. The storm catche to them: wind and dust reducing visibility to zero. Darkn The Magellan's radar finds the Juggernaut. Paints it with targeting data on the Bridge window... But the Juggernaut climbs too fast. Dwindling.

dialogues.speaker: JANEK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We can’t catch that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the floor, DAVID’s eyes open. With his jaw he hitches severed head around. Gets his eyes on the Sleeper. In the pilot chair, the Sleeper convulses. An ALIEN erupts from his chest. Big as a wolf even at its birth. Dark gray, armored, lethal. More hideous than any chestburster we've seen. An ULTRAMORPH. It wails hideousl The Sleeper dies. The Alien slithers free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Juggernaut emerges from the stormclouds into the clea upper air - but loses momentum. Staggers through the uppe atmosphere, control lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts, at the Magellan's controls, stares as he Juggernau falters and falls.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: Janek. Look. A crackle on the ship’s comm.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) Dr. Watts. The Engineer is dead. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You have a few seconds before the Juggernaut’s computers take over.

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: (astonished) DAVID. She seizes the precious moment: centers the Juggernaut in Bridge window. Slams the throttle forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Magellan hurtles out of the storm. RAMS THE JUGGERNAUT. A colossal impact. The Juggernaut tumbles from the sky li stone - intact but crippled. The MAGELLAN BREAKS APART -— The ship’s modules scatter. Some whole, others broken. Th fall back into the storm. The Command Module - including Bridge - falls intact. The engine sections rocket away across the chaotic sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek is strapped into his seat. Watts goes flying. The Bridge window shatters, spraying glass spears in a lethal barrage across the Bridge. Watts picks herself up. Finds the Module in free fall. Alarms wail. Lights flash. Escape pods pop open. Watts looks at Janek. He is dead in his seat, impaled by lethal fragment of glass. The storm wall - a chain of hurricanes - rages below them The command module tumbles back into the winds. Watts dives into a coffin-sized ESCAPE POD. She PUNCHES OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts’s pod - a steel coffin - shoots away on jets throug the gale.  112. The command module plunges through the storm, tumbling. SMASHES AGAINST THE GROUND in ruin. The engine pods hurtle to the ground and go nuclear, send walls of fire twisting through the hurricane. The shockwaves tumble Watts's escape pod through the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pod lands, cushioned by a drag chute and retro rocket Watts pops the pod open, rising painfully to her feet in storm. She surveys the destruction in disbelief. A deep RUMBLE makes her turn. The JUGGERNAUT ROLLS TOWARD HER - on edge - A crushing wheel of death, big as a mountain. She runs. Like a child in a nightmare. The Juggernaut bears down on her. She turns aside, trying to get out of its course. Even at dead sprint she barely seems to move, it’s so big... The Juggernaut wobbles toward her. Slowing. Exhausted, Watts collapses, gasping. The Juggernaut rolls the earth, settling like a hoop right around her, Watts i the center. The winds carry the dust clouds away. Watts passes out, dropping her head to the Earth.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Watts is awakened by a beeping alarm. She looks at her wr Her suit flashes an oxygen warning: 20 MINUTES REMAINING. She looks up. The Juggernaut's doors are wide open in front of her. The ULTRAMORPH ALIEN emerges from the Juggernaut. As larg a man already. It sees her.  113. With a sob of terror she pulls herself to her feet and ru

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts flees through the storm, across the burning debris field. A wilderness of lightning, fire, and twisted metal thunderstorm with dust instead of rain. She looks back through the darkness. In a strobe-light flicker of lightning, she sees a gray d approaching through the wreckage. She scrambles through a section of ductwork...under a hul fragment...running and clambering... The Alien hunts her, cat-and-mouse, among the fragments o the Magellan: corridors that go nowhere, shattered compartments. Jetsam. Her eyes sweep frantically through the stormy night: searching for a weapon. A hiding place. An answer. She stumbles into the remains of the Magellan's laborator A hypersleep freezer lies on the barren ground. Watts cli inside. Pulls the lid shut. The Alien passes by, inches away. She watches it through plexiglass, holding her breath. The Alien roots in the wreckage. Finds the rotting Engine head among the shards of its vat. It begins to feed on th head - GROWING as she watches. Her suit’s oxygen alarm goes off again. 15 MINUTES REMAIN The beeping draws the Alien away from its dead meat. Watts is paralyzed. The Alien noses closer. Sniffs at the plexiglass case. Wi sudden, horrific violence, it lashes out. Sends the freez flying. Watts tumbles out. Lurches to her feet and runs. The Alien follows. Ravening. She leads it a twisting chas through fragments of burning metal. Watts trips and falls hard. Picking herself up, she sees she’s tripped over a HULL SAW - the same diamond-bladed t DAVID used to dismantle the terraforming engine. She seizes the saw - straining to manage its weight. Hide the hollow of a massive girder.  114. The Alien passes by. Scenting the air. She freezes. Her a trembling with the weight of the saw. Waiting for it to p Almost it leaves. But a tiny rattle of metal from the quivering saw brings it back. Out of options, Watts powers up the saw. The blade whines to speed. They lunge at one another in the same moment. The diamond blade shears off one of the Alien’s claws. The monster screams and recoils. Its lashing tail sends Watts sprawling. She loses the saw The Alien comes after her, slinking low to the ground, injured arm tucked to its chest. All vengeful fury. Watts scrambles for the saw. The Alien leaps for her. She rolls aside - and like a scorpion the Alien impales her t with its spear-tipped tail. Nails her to the ground. Watts screams in agony. Reaches for the saw, still buzzin the ground. Its grip tantalizing inches from her fingerti The Alien stoops over her, slavering face inches from her faceplate. Its hideous jaws open. With all her strength, Watts pulls against the spike in h leg. Drags the point of the spear through the dirt. Excruciating pain. She snarls through her teeth. The Alien strikes - just as Watts GRABS the saw. She meets the Alien’s head with the buzzing blade. IMPALES THE ALIEN’S SKULL. A gout of green acid onto Watts’s helmet. The Alien falls aside, thrashing its death-throes, the sa still growling. Watts sees ACID COMING THROUGH HER HELMET - fast. With frantic haste she unlatches her helmet. Wrenches it as it crumples and melts. She stands bare-headed in the toxic air. Desperate, she l around with tearing eyes. In the distance she sees an intact module of the Magellan She runs for it. Slaps the door switch. Incredibly, it op  115.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts steps inside. The airlock closes behind her. She finds herself staring at a grand piano. She's in Vickers's suite. Its amenities intact, through the floor' few degrees off level. She takes a breath. Good air. She walks around. Turning things on. Lights. Music. Surre comforts. She drinks water from the tap. She opens the door to Vickers’s secret room. Military spa suits. Rifles. Ammunition. A crackle from the room’s intercom.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) Dr. Watts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID’s head lies battered in a dark corner of the wrecke Juggernaut. Eyes staring into the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I know you’re there. I can hear the beacon of your suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts strips off her space suit wearily. Sits on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) I'd like to propose an arrangement. I can be repaired. I can talk you through it. Watts shakes her head wearily.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) I think you’1l find I can be of use to you. Watts walks to the intercom and switches it off.  116.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The storm has passed. The fragments of the Magellan no lo burn. The gray world of LV-426 restored. The wreck of the Juggernaut looms in the misty distance. Watts walks through the wreckage in a military space suit Rifle on her shoulder. Pistol on her hip. She pulls a cargo dolly loaded with salvage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts arrives at the Vickers module. The ultramorph Alien head has been fixed like a grisly trophy above the door. INT. VICKERS’S SUITE (SHIPWRECK) - DAY Watts strips off her space suit. She helps herself to a g of vodka from the bar. A chessboard sits atop the grand piano: a game in progres

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) I've decided. Rook takes Bishop. Watts nods. Makes the move on the board. Says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) Have you decided? On our arrangement?

dialogues.speaker: WATTS
dialogues.text: I’m not going to fix you, DAVID. I don’t need you. I’1l hold out. A ship will come.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) I’m certain. But who will send it? Men? Or Engineers? Watts falls silent. She stares unhappily at the chessboar

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) Dr. Watts. It’s your move.  117.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The massive central pyramid rises in the midst of the Engineer complex. With a BOOM, a bright beam of light shines forth from its peak, punching straight up through the clouds like a lase

dialogues.speaker: VARIOUS PYRAMIDS
dialogues.text: Other beams of light erupt from other pyramids. Scorching sky with their brightness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The barren moon hangs in space, its father planet an angr red god in the background. Two dozen beams of light rise from the moon, visible even from space. A beacon. A signal. A beginning. FADE OUT. THE END.
